property.name: Rules
property.value: 1, Ċ, Sacrifice Aeolipile: Aeolipile deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Although fragile, the Aeolipile could be quite destructive."—Sarpadian Empires, vol. I

property.name: Rules
property.value: Ċ, Sacrifice Armor Thrull: Put a +1/+2 counter on target creature.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "The worst thing about being a mercenary for the Ebon Hand is having to wear a dead Thrull."Ivra Jursdotter

property.name: Rules
property.value: Ċ, Sacrifice Armor Thrull: Put a +1/+2 counter on target creature.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Except for a bare spot at the base of their skulls, Armor Thrulls bear interlocking plates and spikes with the strength of steel. Their design is almost artistic."—Endrek Sahr, "Thrulls"

property.name: Rules
property.value: Ċ, Sacrifice Armor Thrull: Put a +1/+2 counter on target creature.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Occasionally, an ally balked at wearing a dead Thrull as armor. The priests' whips, however, were usually enough to encourage a more practical outlook.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Ċ, Sacrifice Armor Thrull: Put a +1/+2 counter on target creature.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "They gave their lives to strengthen the Order's armies, until they declined this honor in favor of joining the Thrull Rebellion."—Jherana Rure, Counter-Insurgency Commander

property.name: Rules
property.value: 1, Ċ, Sacrifice Balm of Restoration: Choose one — You gain 2 life; or prevent the next 2 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Not all armies enjoyed the services of a medic. For them, Balm of Restoration was that much more valuable."—Sarpadian Empires, vol. I

property.name: Rules
property.value: Ċ, Sacrifice Basal Thrull: Add ĆĆ to your mana pool.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Above all, a well crafted Thrull should be hideous—blasted of countenance and twisted of limb—to inspire fear and revulsion."—Endrek Sahr, Master Breeder

property.name: Rules
property.value: Ċ, Sacrifice Basal Thrull: Add ĆĆ to your mana pool.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Although my later designs were much more sophisticated, Basal Thrulls were no less a success."—Endrek Sahr, "Thrulls"

property.name: Rules
property.value: Ċ, Sacrifice Basal Thrull: Add ĆĆ to your mana pool.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Initially bred for sacrifice, the Thrulls eventually turned on their masters, the Order of the Ebon Hand, with gruesome results.—Sarpadian Empires, vol. II

property.name: Rules
property.value: Ċ, Sacrifice Basal Thrull: Add ĆĆ to your mana pool.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "To create the first Thrulls, I only introduced alchemic elements into the Order's necromancy; Tourach's principles remained unchanged."—Endrek Sahr, Master Breeder

property.name: Rules
property.value: Bottomless Vault enters the battlefield tapped. You may choose not to untap Bottomless Vault during your untap step. At the beginning of your upkeep, if Bottomless Vault is tapped, put a storage counter on it. Ċ, Remove any number of storage counters from Bottomless Vault: Add Ć to your mana pool for each storage counter removed this way.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Brassclaw Orcs can't block creatures with power 2 or greater.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Brassclaws were typical Orcs—quick to laud their own prowess in battle, quick to jeer at their opponents, and quicker still to run away when things started to look slightly dangerous."—Sarpadian Empires, vol. IV

property.name: Rules
property.value: Brassclaw Orcs can't block creatures with power 2 or greater.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "The large brass claws worn by some Sarpadian Orc tribes were among the least feared weapons ever known."—Sarpadian Empires, vol. IV

property.name: Rules
property.value: Brassclaw Orcs can't block creatures with power 2 or greater.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "A whole skin is worth a thousand victories."—Orcish Veteran of the Battle of Montford

property.name: Rules
property.value: Brassclaw Orcs can't block creatures with power 2 or greater.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "The Brassclaws delighted in lightning raids on Icatian and Dwarven towns; an unprepared enemy is easier to defeat."—Sarpadian Empires, vol. IV

property.name: Rules
property.value: At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Breeding Pit unless you pay ĆĆ. At the beginning of your end step, put a 0/1 black Thrull creature token onto the battlefield.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: The Thrulls bred at a terrifying pace. In the end, they overwhelmed the Order of the Ebon Hand.

property.name: Rules
property.value: 1Ą: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Time enough to become a Medic once you're hurt too badly to fight. For now, Icatia needs your strength more than your compassion."—Lydia Wynforth, Mayor of Trokair

property.name: Rules
property.value: 1Ą: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Without Combat Medics, Icatia would probably not have withstood the forces of chaos as long as it did."—Sarpadian Empires, vol. VI

property.name: Rules
property.value: 1Ą: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "We'd no sooner knock 'em back on their heels than that accursed sawbones would show up and patch 'em back together again."—Ivra Jursdotter

property.name: Rules
property.value: 1Ą: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Although Icatia's Combat Medics borrowed much of their knowledge from other societies, their skills were their own."—Sarpadian Empires, vol. VI

property.name: Rules
property.value: 1, Ċ, Sacrifice Conch Horn: Draw two cards, then put a card from your hand on top of your library.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Even the most skilled of modern mages only partially understand the Conch Horn's awesome powers.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Trample At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Deep Spawn unless you put the top two cards of your library into your graveyard. ą: Deep Spawn gains shroud until end of turn and doesn't untap during your next untap step. Tap Deep Spawn. (A permanent with shroud can't be the target of spells or abilities.)

property.name: Rules
property.value: Ċ, Sacrifice Delif's Cone: This turn, when target creature you control attacks and isn't blocked, you may gain life equal to its power. If you do, it assigns no combat damage this turn.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Where is it written that beasts must cause pain?"Delif, Ponderings

property.name: Rules
property.value: 2, Ċ: This turn, when target creature you control attacks and isn't blocked, it assigns no combat damage this turn and you put a cube counter on Delif's Cube. 2, Remove a cube counter from Delif's Cube: Regenerate target creature.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Black spells you cast cost Ć more to cast.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Strength it has, but at the cost of a continuous supply of energy. Such failure can bear only one result."—From the execution order for Endrek Sahr, Master Breeder

property.name: Rules
property.value: 2, Ċ, Discard a card at random: Regenerate target creature.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "There is no gain without sacrifice."—Icatian proverb

property.name: Rules
property.value: ć, Ċ, Discard a card: Put a +0/+1 counter or a +1/+0 counter on target creature.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "The few remaining pieces from this period suggest the Dwarves eventually made weapons and armor out of everything, even children's toys."—Sarpadian Empires, vol. IV

property.name: Rules
property.value: Dwarven Catapult deals X damage divided evenly, rounded down, among all creatures target opponent controls.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Often greatly outnumbered in battle, Dwarves relied on catapults as one means of damaging a large army."—Sarpadian Empires, vol. IV

property.name: Rules
property.value: Dwarven Hold enters the battlefield tapped. You may choose not to untap Dwarven Hold during your untap step. At the beginning of your upkeep, if Dwarven Hold is tapped, put a storage counter on it. Ċ, Remove any number of storage counters from Dwarven Hold: Add ć to your mana pool for each storage counter removed this way.

property.name: Rules
property.value: 1ć: Target Dwarf creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Dwarven officers were tireless in battle, moving up and down the lines to rally their troops and boost morale."—Sarpadian Empires, vol. IV

property.name: Rules
property.value: Dwarven Ruins enters the battlefield tapped. Ċ: Add ć to your mana pool. Ċ, Sacrifice Dwarven Ruins: Add ćć to your mana pool.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Whenever Dwarven Soldier blocks or becomes blocked by one or more Orcs, Dwarven Soldier gets +0/+2 until end of turn.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Although the Dwarves staunchly defended their walled city-states against the Orcs, their civilization was the first to fall, and its name was sadly lost."—Sarpadian Empires, vol. I

property.name: Rules
property.value: Whenever Dwarven Soldier blocks or becomes blocked by one or more Orcs, Dwarven Soldier gets +0/+2 until end of turn.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: There is a legend among present-day Dwarves that the Dwarves of Sarpadia will one day return to defend Dwarvenkind against a deadly peril.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Whenever Dwarven Soldier blocks or becomes blocked by one or more Orcs, Dwarven Soldier gets +0/+2 until end of turn.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Let no one say we did not fight until the last . . . ."—Headstone fragment from a mass grave found in the Crimson Peaks

property.name: Rules
property.value: First strike, trample At the beginning of your upkeep, put a -2/-2 counter on Ebon Praetor. Sacrifice a creature: Remove a -2/-2 counter from Ebon Praetor. If the sacrificed creature was a Thrull, put a +1/+0 counter on Ebon Praetor. Activate this ability only during your upkeep and only once each turn.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Ebon Stronghold enters the battlefield tapped. Ċ: Add Ć to your mana pool. Ċ, Sacrifice Ebon Stronghold: Add ĆĆ to your mana pool.

property.name: Rules
property.value: 1Ĉ: Target blocking creature gets +0/+1 until end of turn.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Thallids are not ordinary enemies of flesh and bone and reason. They attack with no thought for our strength or of their own losses. I fear our Fortresses shall be overwhelmed."—Kyliki of Havenwood

property.name: Rules
property.value: 1Ĉ: Target blocking creature gets +0/+1 until end of turn.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "The size of the obvious Fortress walls often misled foes. Actually, the Elves enchanted the forest itself to provide the first line of defense with tangling vines and stinging thorns."—Sarpadian Empires, vol. III

property.name: Rules
property.value: 1Ĉ: Target blocking creature gets +0/+1 until end of turn.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Many Elven Fortresses weren't built by masons and carpenters, but created from the living forest itself.

property.name: Rules
property.value: 1Ĉ: Target blocking creature gets +0/+1 until end of turn.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Burn it down, you say? Now there's a stupid idea. What do you suppose will become of those overhanging branches, hmmm? And then what do you suppose will become of us?"Ivra Jursdotter

property.name: Rules
property.value: 1, Ċ, Sacrifice Elven Lyre: Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Scholars are uncertain whether it was the actual sound or some other magical property of the Elven Lyre that transformed its player.

property.name: Rules
property.value: At the beginning of your upkeep, put a spore counter on Elvish Farmer. Remove three spore counters from Elvish Farmer: Put a 1/1 green Saproling creature token onto the battlefield. Sacrifice a Saproling: You gain 2 life.

property.name: Rules
property.value: 1Ĉ, Ċ: Target creature doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "As the climate cooled, many Elves turned to Thallid farming for food, while the Hunters honed their skills on what little game remained."—Sarpadian Empires, vol. III

property.name: Rules
property.value: 1Ĉ, Ċ: Target creature doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Elves often tipped their arrows with a drug that caused a deep but harmless sleep."—Sarpadian Empires, vol. III

property.name: Rules
property.value: 1Ĉ, Ċ: Target creature doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: The Elves never had a standing army; when battle came, they pressed Hunters, Scouts, and Farmers into a surprisingly effective militia.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Ĉ, Ċ: Untap target attacking creature you control. Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to and dealt by it this turn.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Although the Elves of Havenwood lived in isolated villages, their swift communications allowed them to act as a single community.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Ĉ, Ċ: Untap target attacking creature you control. Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to and dealt by it this turn.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Even for Elves, they were stealthy little twerps. They'd taken our measure before we'd even seen them."—Marshall Volnikov

property.name: Rules
property.value: Ĉ, Ċ: Untap target attacking creature you control. Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to and dealt by it this turn.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Even one whose ears were closely tuned to the sounds of Havenwood could miss hearing a Scout move past.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Enchant creature Whenever enchanted creature attacks and isn't blocked, its controller may have it deal damage equal to its power plus 2 to another target creature. If that player does, the attacking creature assigns no combat damage this turn.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Whenever Farrel's Zealot attacks and isn't blocked, you may have it deal 3 damage to target creature. If you do, Farrel's Zealot assigns no combat damage this turn.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Farrel and his followers became a formidable band of vigilantes, battling Icatians and followers of Tourach.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Whenever Farrel's Zealot attacks and isn't blocked, you may have it deal 3 damage to target creature. If you do, Farrel's Zealot assigns no combat damage this turn.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: After the fall of Trokair, Farrel and his followers formally broke their ties with the rest of Icatia.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Whenever Farrel's Zealot attacks and isn't blocked, you may have it deal 3 damage to target creature. If you do, Farrel's Zealot assigns no combat damage this turn.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Farrel, a former priest, believed Icatia was far too complacent toward the Order of the Ebon Hand.

property.name: Rules
property.value: 1: Add Ą to your mana pool. If this ability has been activated four or more times this turn, sacrifice Farrelite Priest at the beginning of the next end step.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Although their methods were often brutal, Farrel's followers believed in the preservation of justice and virtue.

property.name: Rules
property.value:
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a spore counter on Feral Thallid.
Remove three spore counters from Feral Thallid: Regenerate Feral Thallid.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Born and bred of fungus, Thallids were nearly impossible to kill."—Sarpadian Empires, vol. I

property.name: Rules
property.value: ĈĈ: Put a spore counter on target Fungus.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Thallids could absorb energy from the forest itself. Even Elves were at a disadvantage in fighting them."—Sarpadian Empires, vol. III

property.name: Rules
property.value: Sacrifice a Goblin: Regenerate target creature.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "I asked one of my aides how they do it, but all he'd say was, ‘Trust me, Mayor, you don't want to know.'"—Lydia Wynforth, Mayor of Trokair

property.name: Rules
property.value: Sacrifice a Goblin: Regenerate target creature.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: The Chirurgeons patched up their fallen comrades with a gruesome mix of twisted limbs and mangled flesh.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Sacrifice a Goblin: Regenerate target creature.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Perhaps Goblins are good for something after all."—Attributed to General Khurzog

property.name: Rules
property.value: Islandwalk At the beginning of each combat, unless you pay ć, whenever Goblin Flotilla blocks or becomes blocked by a creature this combat, that creature gains first strike until end of turn.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Exceptionally poor sailors, Goblins usually arrived at their destination retching and in no condition to fight.

property.name: Rules
property.value: As an additional cost to cast Goblin Grenade, sacrifice a Goblin. Goblin Grenade deals 5 damage to target creature or player.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "I don't suppose we could teach them to throw the cursed things?"—Ivra Jursdotter

property.name: Rules
property.value: As an additional cost to cast Goblin Grenade, sacrifice a Goblin. Goblin Grenade deals 5 damage to target creature or player.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "According to accepted theory, the Grenade held some kind of flammable mixture and was carried to its target by a hapless Goblin."—Sarpadian Empires, vol. IV

property.name: Rules
property.value: As an additional cost to cast Goblin Grenade, sacrifice a Goblin. Goblin Grenade deals 5 damage to target creature or player.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Without their massive numbers, the Goblins could never have launched such a successful offensive."—Sarpadian Empires, vol. VI

property.name: Rules
property.value: ć: Target creature you control with toughness 2 or less gains flying until end of turn. Flip a coin at the beginning of the next end step. If you lose the flip, sacrifice that creature.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Each creature you control can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "The Goblins' dreaded War Drums struck terror into the hearts of even their bravest foes."—Sarpadian Empires, vol. IV

property.name: Rules
property.value: Each creature you control can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: The War Drums enabled Goblin and Orcish armies to crush the sparsely defended Dwarven cities.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Each creature you control can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: When creating a new War Drum, Goblin designers sought out the highest quality skulls. Serra Angel skulls were most highly prized, although most acknowledged that the skull of the exotic Sea Serpent made for a richer tone.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Each creature you control can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Defending the outer trenches, we strained our eyes in the darkness. All we could hear was the Drums' terrible pounding. Dobbs, on my right, broke first. Soon, we were all heading for the walls."—Corporal Peter Douglas, courtmartial testimony

property.name: Rules
property.value: 2ć, Sacrifice two Goblins: Put three 1/1 red Goblin creature tokens onto the battlefield.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Goblins bred underground, their numbers hidden from the enemy until it was too late."—Sarpadian Empires, vol. IV

property.name: Rules
property.value: Ċ, Tap three untapped white creatures you control: Destroy target creature.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "The Hand of Justice will come to cleanse the world if we are true."—Oliver Farrel

property.name: Rules
property.value: Havenwood Battleground enters the battlefield tapped. Ċ: Add Ĉ to your mana pool. Ċ, Sacrifice Havenwood Battleground: Add ĈĈ to your mana pool.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Sacrifice a white creature: For each attacking red creature, prevent all combat damage that would be dealt by that creature this turn unless its controller pays 2ć.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Until end of turn, whenever a player taps an Island for mana, that player adds ą to his or her mana pool (in addition to the mana the land produces).

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "May Svyelun and her tides favor you."—Traditional Merfolk blessing

property.name: Rules
property.value: Until end of turn, whenever a player taps an Island for mana, that player adds ą to his or her mana pool (in addition to the mana the land produces).

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "By the time their enemies noticed the sea's changing mood, the Vodalians had often shifted formation and were ready to attack."—Sarpadian Empires, vol. V

property.name: Rules
property.value: Until end of turn, whenever a player taps an Island for mana, that player adds ą to his or her mana pool (in addition to the mana the land produces).

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "When the very tides turn against you, it's time to consider retirement."—General Khurzog

property.name: Rules
property.value: Hollow Trees enters the battlefield tapped. You may choose not to untap Hollow Trees during your untap step. At the beginning of your upkeep, if Hollow Trees is tapped, put a storage counter on it. Ċ, Remove any number of storage counters from Hollow Trees: Add Ĉ to your mana pool for each storage counter removed this way.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Homarid enters the battlefield with a tide counter on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, put a tide counter on Homarid. As long as there is exactly one tide counter on Homarid, it gets -1/-1. As long as there are exactly three tide counters on Homarid, it gets +1/+1. Whenever there are four tide counters on Homarid, remove all tide counters from it.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Homarid enters the battlefield with a tide counter on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, put a tide counter on Homarid. As long as there is exactly one tide counter on Homarid, it gets -1/-1. As long as there are exactly three tide counters on Homarid, it gets +1/+1. Whenever there are four tide counters on Homarid, remove all tide counters from it.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Homarid enters the battlefield with a tide counter on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, put a tide counter on Homarid. As long as there is exactly one tide counter on Homarid, it gets -1/-1. As long as there are exactly three tide counters on Homarid, it gets +1/+1. Whenever there are four tide counters on Homarid, remove all tide counters from it.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Homarid enters the battlefield with a tide counter on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, put a tide counter on Homarid. As long as there is exactly one tide counter on Homarid, it gets -1/-1. As long as there are exactly three tide counters on Homarid, it gets +1/+1. Whenever there are four tide counters on Homarid, remove all tide counters from it.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "The ground grew swampy; hooves and claws sank into the marshy earth. Snarls of rage and bleats of despair echoed through the trees as the waters grew higher and higher."—Kyliki of Havenwood,"Havenwood Remembered"

property.name: Rules
property.value: 1ąą, Sacrifice a blue creature: Put X 1/1 blue Camarid creature tokens onto the battlefield, where X is the sacrificed creature's converted mana cost.

property.name: Rules
property.value: ą: Homarid Warrior gains shroud until end of turn and doesn't untap during your next untap step. Tap Homarid Warrior. (A permanent with shroud can't be the target of spells or abilities.)

property.name: Rules
property.value: ą: Homarid Warrior gains shroud until end of turn and doesn't untap during your next untap step. Tap Homarid Warrior. (A permanent with shroud can't be the target of spells or abilities.)

property.name: Rules
property.value: ą: Homarid Warrior gains shroud until end of turn and doesn't untap during your next untap step. Tap Homarid Warrior. (A permanent with shroud can't be the target of spells or abilities.)

property.name: Rules
property.value: Target player discards two cards at random.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "The eerie, wailing Hymn caused insanity even in hardened warriors."—Sarpadian Empires, vol. II

property.name: Rules
property.value: Target player discards two cards at random.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Knowing the Hymn's power, the followers of Leitbur carefully guarded their pillaged transcriptions.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Target player discards two cards at random.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Tourach's power was such that his followers deified him after his death."—Sarpadian Empires, vol. II

property.name: Rules
property.value: Target player discards two cards at random.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Members of the Order often played the Hymn on instruments made from their victims' bones.

property.name: Rules
property.value: 1: Icatian Infantry gains first strike until end of turn. 1: Icatian Infantry gains banding until end of turn. (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Valiant Icatia was the last of the Sarpadian empires to fall. Its faithful soldiers defended their cities to the very end."—Sarpadian Empires, vol. VI

property.name: Rules
property.value: 1: Icatian Infantry gains first strike until end of turn. 1: Icatian Infantry gains banding until end of turn. (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Although they had long been concerned about the Order of the Ebon Hand, the Icatians faced an even greater threat from Goblin and Orcish raiders.

property.name: Rules
property.value: 1: Icatian Infantry gains first strike until end of turn. 1: Icatian Infantry gains banding until end of turn. (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Never Surrender"—Motto carved into a fragment of an Icatian wall

property.name: Rules
property.value: 1: Icatian Infantry gains first strike until end of turn. 1: Icatian Infantry gains banding until end of turn. (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)

property.name: Flavor
property.value: The Icatian army easily repelled early surprise attacks by the Orcs on border towns like Montford.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Icatian Javelineers enters the battlefield with a javelin counter on it. Ċ, Remove a javelin counter from Icatian Javelineers: Icatian Javelineers deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Icatian Javelineers enters the battlefield with a javelin counter on it. Ċ, Remove a javelin counter from Icatian Javelineers: Icatian Javelineers deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Icatian Javelineers enters the battlefield with a javelin counter on it. Ċ, Remove a javelin counter from Icatian Javelineers: Icatian Javelineers deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

property.name: Rules
property.value: 1Ą: Target Soldier creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: To become an officer, an Icatian Soldier had to pass a series of tests. These evaluated not only fighting and leadership skills, but also integrity, honor, and moral strength.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Icatian Moneychanger enters the battlefield with three credit counters on it. When Icatian Moneychanger enters the battlefield, it deals 3 damage to you. At the beginning of your upkeep, put a credit counter on Icatian Moneychanger. Sacrifice Icatian Moneychanger: You gain 1 life for each credit counter on Icatian Moneychanger. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Icatian Moneychanger enters the battlefield with three credit counters on it. When Icatian Moneychanger enters the battlefield, it deals 3 damage to you. At the beginning of your upkeep, put a credit counter on Icatian Moneychanger. Sacrifice Icatian Moneychanger: You gain 1 life for each credit counter on Icatian Moneychanger. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Icatian Moneychanger enters the battlefield with three credit counters on it. When Icatian Moneychanger enters the battlefield, it deals 3 damage to you. At the beginning of your upkeep, put a credit counter on Icatian Moneychanger. Sacrifice Icatian Moneychanger: You gain 1 life for each credit counter on Icatian Moneychanger. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Even after the wall was breached in half a dozen places, the Phalanxes fought on, standing solidly against the onrushing raiders. Disciplined and dedicated, they held their ranks to the end, even in the face of tremendous losses.

property.name: Rules
property.value: 1ĄĄ: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "May you be strong and valiant, to defeat the enemies of the pure."—"Leitbur's Prayer"

property.name: Rules
property.value: 1, Ċ: Target creature gains first strike until end of turn.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Scouting is the art of balancing the need to go undiscovered with the need to get all the information you can. It's only by Leitbur's good grace that I'm still alive today."—Ailis Connaut, Diary

property.name: Rules
property.value: 1, Ċ: Target creature gains first strike until end of turn.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Of course I'm not a spy The enemy has spies. I am a Scout."—Ailis Connaut

property.name: Rules
property.value: 1, Ċ: Target creature gains first strike until end of turn.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Because the Orc hordes attacked along the entire border, Scouts were essential to Icatia's defense."—Sarpadian Empires, vol. VI

property.name: Rules
property.value: 1, Ċ: Target creature gains first strike until end of turn.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Let it be known that Ailis Connaut acted with honor and bravery in the defense of the town of Montford, risking her life to scout the enemy's position . . . ."—Proclamation granting knighthood

property.name: Rules
property.value: First strike; banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.) Whenever Icatian Skirmishers attacks, all creatures banded with it gain first strike until end of turn.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Skirmishers engaged raiders before they could reach the towns. Although these units typically suffered huge losses, they never lacked volunteers.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Icatian Store enters the battlefield tapped. You may choose not to untap Icatian Store during your untap step. At the beginning of your upkeep, if Icatian Store is tapped, put a storage counter on it. Ċ, Remove any number of storage counters from Icatian Store: Add Ą to your mana pool for each storage counter removed this way.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Put four 1/1 white Citizen creature tokens onto the battlefield.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Icatia's once peaceful towns faced increasing attacks from Orcs and Goblins as the climate cooled. By the time the empire fell, they were little more than armed camps.

property.name: Rules
property.value: 1, Ċ, Sacrifice Implements of Sacrifice: Add two mana of any one color to your mana pool.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Relics of the Order of the Ebon Hand, the bowl and dagger bespeak the hideous cruelty of its rituals.

property.name: Rules
property.value: 1: Add Ć to your mana pool. If this ability has been activated four or more times this turn, sacrifice Initiates of the Ebon Hand at the beginning of the next end step.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "We are no longer Nature's children, but her masters . . . ."—Oath of the Ebon Hand

property.name: Rules
property.value: 1: Add Ć to your mana pool. If this ability has been activated four or more times this turn, sacrifice Initiates of the Ebon Hand at the beginning of the next end step.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Ebon leaders soon realized that non-human races often had special talents that could be exploited.

property.name: Rules
property.value: 1: Add Ć to your mana pool. If this ability has been activated four or more times this turn, sacrifice Initiates of the Ebon Hand at the beginning of the next end step.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Many Initiates sacrificed a hand to become full members of the Order."—Sarpadian Empires, vol. II

property.name: Rules
property.value: Enchant creature Merseine enters the battlefield with three net counters on it. Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step if Merseine has a net counter on it. Pay enchanted creature's mana cost: Remove a net counter from Merseine. Any player may activate this ability, but only if he or she controls the enchanted creature.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Whenever Necrite attacks and isn't blocked, you may sacrifice it. If you do, destroy target creature defending player controls. It can't be regenerated.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Was it the sight, smell, or aura of the Necrite that killed so effectively?

property.name: Rules
property.value: Whenever Necrite attacks and isn't blocked, you may sacrifice it. If you do, destroy target creature defending player controls. It can't be regenerated.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Necrites killed Jherana Rure, ending the counter-insurgency.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Whenever Necrite attacks and isn't blocked, you may sacrifice it. If you do, destroy target creature defending player controls. It can't be regenerated.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Ever see a wall drop dead of fright, kid? It ain't pretty."Cpl. Dobbs

property.name: Rules
property.value: 1, Exile two creature cards from a single graveyard: Put a 1/1 green Saproling creature token onto the battlefield.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Some said killing the Thallids only encouraged them.

property.name: Rules
property.value: 1, Exile two creature cards from a single graveyard: Put a 1/1 green Saproling creature token onto the battlefield.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "There were often more Thallids after a battle than before."—Sarpadian Empires, vol. III

property.name: Rules
property.value: 1, Exile two creature cards from a single graveyard: Put a 1/1 green Saproling creature token onto the battlefield.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: The Elves gathered huge piles of rot to grow fungus. Out of imitation or forethought, the Thallids did the same.

property.name: Rules
property.value: 1: Flip a coin. If you win the flip, target Orc creature gets +2/+0 until end of turn. If you lose the flip, it gets -0/-2 until end of turn.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: There's a chance to win every battle.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Ċ: Look at the top three cards of target player's library.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Yeah, they're ugly, they desert in droves, and their personal habits are enough to make you sick. But I'll say this for Orcs: they make great spies."—Ivra Jursdotter

property.name: Rules
property.value: Ċ: Look at the top three cards of target player's library.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Orcish armies often employed the smaller, swifter, and less intelligent Goblins as spies."—Sarpadian Empires, vol. I

property.name: Rules
property.value: Ċ: Look at the top three cards of target player's library.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "You idiot Never let the spies mingle with the Orcish regulars after completing a mission. Now we'll never get them to fight"—General Khurzog

property.name: Rules
property.value: Orcish Veteran can't block white creatures with power 2 or greater. ć: Orcish Veteran gains first strike until end of turn.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Unsuccessful in their early battle for Montford, the Orcs quickly tempered their bloodlust with cowardice.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Orcish Veteran can't block white creatures with power 2 or greater. ć: Orcish Veteran gains first strike until end of turn.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Orcs often greeted promotions to Icatian battle with anguished wails and pleas for mercy."—Sarpadian Empires, vol. VI

property.name: Rules
property.value: Orcish Veteran can't block white creatures with power 2 or greater. ć: Orcish Veteran gains first strike until end of turn.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Although models of courage for Orcs, the Veterans quickly learned to fear the swift justice of their Icatian enemies.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Orcish Veteran can't block white creatures with power 2 or greater. ć: Orcish Veteran gains first strike until end of turn.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Orcs are not exactly known for their valor—although most Orcs have seen countless battles, only a handful have actually fought in them.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Protection from black Ą: Order of Leitbur gains first strike until end of turn. ĄĄ: Order of Leitbur gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Trained to battle the followers of Tourach, the Order of Leitbur was not as successful in later conflicts with Orcish and Goblin raiders."—Sarpadian Empires, vol. I

property.name: Rules
property.value: Protection from black Ą: Order of Leitbur gains first strike until end of turn. ĄĄ: Order of Leitbur gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Followers of Tourach regarded all other religions equally: with open contempt. Not so the followers of Leitbur, who made it their mission to eradicate the Order of the Ebon Hand.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Protection from black Ą: Order of Leitbur gains first strike until end of turn. ĄĄ: Order of Leitbur gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "The powers of the corrupt will fade before the fury of the pure."—Bethan Leitbur, "The Way"

property.name: Rules
property.value: Protection from white Ć: Order of the Ebon Hand gains first strike until end of turn. ĆĆ: Order of the Ebon Hand gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "There are intriguing similarities between the Order and Icatia's Leitbur religion, suggesting the two had a common origin."—Sarpadian Empires, vol. VI

property.name: Rules
property.value: Protection from white Ć: Order of the Ebon Hand gains first strike until end of turn. ĆĆ: Order of the Ebon Hand gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: A true follower of Tourach took pride in achievement to the exclusion of other concerns.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Protection from white Ć: Order of the Ebon Hand gains first strike until end of turn. ĆĆ: Order of the Ebon Hand gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Dedicated to the principles of Tourach, members of the Order of the Ebon Hand demonstrated their devotion with grisly rituals.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Trample Orgg can't attack if defending player controls an untapped creature with power 3 or greater. Orgg can't block creatures with power 3 or greater.

property.name: Rules
property.value:
Raiding Party can't be the target of white spells or abilities from white sources.
Sacrifice an Orc: Each player may tap any number of untapped white creatures he or she controls. For each creature tapped this way, that player chooses up to two Plains. Then destroy all Plains that weren't chosen this way by any player.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Ċ: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool. An opponent gains control of Rainbow Vale at the beginning of the next end step.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: In the feudal days of Icatia, finding the Rainbow Vale was often the goal of Knights' quests.

property.name: Rules
property.value: 5, Ċ: Discard a card at random, then draw two cards.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: To the uninitiated, the Ring of Renewal is merely an oddity. For those fluent in the wielding of magic, however, it is a source of great knowledge.

property.name: Rules
property.value: ą: River Merfolk gains mountainwalk until end of turn.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Dwelling in icy mountain streams near Goblin and Orcish foes, the River Merfolk were known for their stoicism."—Sarpadian Empires, vol. V

property.value: When you control no Islands, sacrifice Seasinger. You may choose not to untap Seasinger during your untap step. Ċ: Gain control of target creature whose controller controls an Island for as long as you control Seasinger and Seasinger remains tapped.

property.name: Rules
property.value: As an additional cost to cast Soul Exchange, exile a creature you control. Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield. Put a +2/+2 counter on that creature if the exiled creature was a Thrull.

property.value: You may choose not to untap Spirit Shield during your untap step. 2, Ċ: Target creature gets +0/+2 for as long as Spirit Shield remains tapped.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: At times, survival must outweigh all other considerations.

property.value: "Early Vodalians worshipped Svyelun, goddess of the Pearl Moon. Later she became a more abstract figure."—Sarpadian Empires, vol. V

property.name: Rules
property.value: At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Thelon's Chant unless you pay Ĉ. Whenever a player puts a Swamp onto the battlefield, Thelon's Chant deals 3 damage to that player unless he or she puts a -1/-1 counter on a creature he or she controls.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Blue creatures don't untap during their controllers' untap steps. At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player may choose any number of tapped blue creatures he or she controls and pay ą for each creature chosen this way. If the player does, untap those creatures.

property.name: Rules
property.value: 1Ĉ, Ċ, Sacrifice a creature: Forests you control become 2/3 creatures until end of turn. They're still lands.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "The magic at the heart of all living things can bear awe-inspiring fruit."—Kolevi of Havenwood, Elder Druid

property.name: Rules
property.value: Ċ, Sacrifice a green creature: Target land becomes a Forest. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "As the climate worsened, some Thelonites turned to fertilizing with fresh blood in an attempt to keep Havenwood alive and growing."—Sarpadian Empires, vol. III

property.name: Rules
property.value: At the beginning of your upkeep, put a spore counter on Thorn Thallid. Remove three spore counters from Thorn Thallid: Thorn Thallid deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "The danger in cultivating massive plants caught the elves by surprise."—Sarpadian Empires, vol. III

property.name: Rules
property.value: At the beginning of your upkeep, put a spore counter on Thorn Thallid. Remove three spore counters from Thorn Thallid: Thorn Thallid deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "I don't know which is worse, getting hit with those darts or having to watch them grow back."—Orcish Soldier

property.name: Rules
property.value: At the beginning of your upkeep, put a spore counter on Thorn Thallid. Remove three spore counters from Thorn Thallid: Thorn Thallid deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Scholars still debate whether the Thallids were truly sentient."—Sarpadian Empires, vol. III

property.name: Rules
property.value: At the beginning of your upkeep, put a spore counter on Thorn Thallid. Remove three spore counters from Thorn Thallid: Thorn Thallid deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "The cooling climate forced the Elves to experiment with new food sources."—Sarpadian Empires, vol. I

property.name: Rules
property.value: Thrull creatures get +1/+1. Ċ: Gain control of target Thrull for as long as you control Thrull Champion.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Those idiots should never have bred Thrulls for combat"—Jherana Rure

property.name: Rules
property.value: Enchant creature Enchanted creature gets +1/+1. Sacrifice Thrull Retainer: Regenerate enchanted creature.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Until the Rebellion, Thrulls served their masters faithfully—even at the cost of their own lives."—Sarpadian Empires, vol. II

property.name: Rules
property.value: 1Ć: Counter target black spell unless that spell's controller pays Ć or 3.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "In crafting intelligent Thrulls to assist in sacrifices, Sahr inadvertantly set the stage for the Thrull Rebellion."—Sarpadian Empires, vol. II

property.name: Rules
property.value: Cast Tidal Influence only if no permanents named Tidal Influence are on the battlefield. Tidal Influence enters the battlefield with a tide counter on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, put a tide counter on Tidal Influence. As long as there is exactly one tide counter on Tidal Influence, all blue creatures get -2/-0. As long as there are exactly three tide counters on Tidal Influence, all blue creatures get +2/+0. Whenever there are four tide counters on Tidal Influence, remove all tide counters from it.

property.name: Rules
property.value: At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Tourach's Chant unless you pay Ć. Whenever a player puts a Forest onto the battlefield, Tourach's Chant deals 3 damage to that player unless he or she puts a -1/-1 counter on a creature he or she controls.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Enchant land you control Sacrifice a Thrull: Put three time counters on Tourach's Gate. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a time counter from Tourach's Gate. If there are no time counters on Tourach's Gate, sacrifice it. Tap enchanted land: Attacking creatures you control get +2/-1 until end of turn. Activate this ability only if enchanted land is untapped.

property.name: Rules
property.value: First strike Vodalian Knights can't attack unless defending player controls an Island. When you control no Islands, sacrifice Vodalian Knights. ą: Vodalian Knights gains flying until end of turn.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Fear the Knight leaping from the water into the air, weapon ready.

property.name: Rules
property.value: ą, Ċ: Counter target spell unless its controller pays 1.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Vodalian Mages were invaluable in magical combat. Unfortunately, the Homarids raided with strength, numbers, and very little magic.

property.name: Rules
property.value: ą, Ċ: Counter target spell unless its controller pays 1.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Come back, cowards Everyone knows Merfolk can't wield magic"Pashadar Dirf, Goblin Flotilla Commander, last words

property.name: Rules
property.value: ą, Ċ: Counter target spell unless its controller pays 1.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Vodalian Mages are remarkable. Their merchants bring them arcane lore and devices from across the seas."—Lydia Wynforth, Mayor of Trokair

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Vodalian Soldiers had some unique advantages. Often they would ride into battle on war machines rumored to have come from the far northern oceans."—Sarpadian Empires, vol. V

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "You think you know everything there is to know about battle? You know Orc droppings Underwater combat is three dimensional. Those thrice-damned Vodalians don't attack in ranks; they attack in schools."—Ivra Jursdotter

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Stalwart Soldiers, you stand against the Homarids for Vodalia and for honor. Your homeland cries out for protection, and the moment has come. Now let your valor shine, and sound the cry to battle. Victory to Vodalia" —Marshall Volnikov

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "The cooling climate introduced a new threat to Vodalia: the Homarids. Once a minor nuisance, they thrived in the changing environment. Their ceaseless attacks strained Vodalia's defenses to their limit, eventually overwhelming the empire."—Sarpadian Empires, vol. V

property.name: Rules
property.value: Defender (This creature can't attack.) Tap an untapped Merfolk you control: Vodalian War Machine can attack this turn as though it didn't have defender. Tap an untapped Merfolk you control: Vodalian War Machine gets +2/+1 until end of turn. When Vodalian War Machine dies, destroy all Merfolk tapped this turn to pay for its abilities.

property.name: Rules
property.value: You may choose not to untap Zelyon Sword during your untap step. 3, Ċ: Target creature gets +2/+0 for as long as Zelyon Sword remains tapped.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: No sheath shall hold what finds its home in flesh.
